intro: Nidorella senecionea, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant is notable for its yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has a low, spreading growth habit with hairy, succulent leaves adapted to conserve water. Nidorella senecionea is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is well-suited to harsh, dry environments.
